subject: Re: Using SCIM to type Quikscript
msgSnippet: Thanks for your interest, Tim.  I ll put a tarball up sometime over the coming weekend. My tables use Peter Guiness layout, the winner of the poll conducted
messageBody:
Thanks for your interest, Tim. I'll put a tarball up sometime over the coming weekend.
My tables use Peter Guiness' layout, the winner of the poll conducted in this group in January. You can see it at qs_keybd_proposals-layout-20080111.pdf.
If you don't like Peter's layout, I have some Python code that can spit out SCIM tables for any keyboard layout we put in. So I could do you a bespoke SCIM table. I'd also like to do a Shavian one some time - when time allows.
If you don't yet have SCIM installed - I can't comment directly on how to do it in Ubuntu. (It's SuSE and VectorLinux in this household.) But I have put together instructions on how to install SCIM in VectorLinux, here. Some of it may help.--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "tim_rice09" <tim_rice09@...> wrote:
>
> Yes, I'm verat > (Ubuntu 8.40) and miss the Shavian and Quickscript keyboard layouts I
> made. I had interest in making an SCIM table for Shavian (Linux
> actually implements Unicode!) but my skills in the area are altogether
> lacking.
>
> If you could post the table, I would gladly test it. Which layout does
> it use?
>
> Thanks a lot.
>
>
